gujarati.couplet:
અતિ ઉત્તમ આખ્યાનની, કહી વણપૂછી મેં વાત<RHYME_209872>; 
હવે શ્રીહરિની કથા, કહું સુણો સહુ સાક્ષાત<RHYME_209872>.
gujarati.context: The story of Sri Hari's greatness is being told; I'm sharing it with you, listening intently and respectfully.

gujarati.couplet:
મહા મનોહર મૂરતિ, શોભે વરણીને વેશ<RHYME_209873>; 
શિખા સૂત્ર સોયામણું, શીશે તે સુંદર કેશ<RHYME_209873>.
gujarati.context: A beautiful woman adorns her complexion with makeup, and with that, her entire being is transformed. Her hair, once simple, becomes lovely as she prepares for the day.

gujarati.couplet:
નાસાગ્રે વૃત્તિ રહે, અને દ્રષ્ટિ તે અનિમેષ; 
એવા થકા ત્યાં આવિયા, બહુનામી કૃષ્ણ દિનેશ.
gujarati.context:
Without a goal, habits remain; and perception becomes numb.

People go to those places out of habit, with many names and fame on the day of Lord Krishna's descent.

gujarati.couplet:
આવી નાહી એ વાવ્યમાં, પછી બેઠા કાંઠે નાથ<RHYME_209874>; 
એવે સમે સુખાનંદ આવ્યા, નીર્ખી થયા સનાથ<RHYME_209874>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the couplet:

One who doesn't come when invited may sit later at another's doorstep; but when one arrives with joy and happiness, their worth is recognized.

gujarati.couplet:
નીર્ખી નાથને પામ્યા આશ્ચર્ય<RHYME_209875>, અંગે ત્યાગ અતિ તપશ્ચર્ય<RHYME_209875>; 
શીલ સંતોષ ને ક્ષમા અતિ, જાણું ધરી વૈરાગ્યે મૂરતિ.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the surprise and admiration one feels when they witness someone's self-control and detachment from worldly attachments, considering it a remarkable feat of spiritual discipline.

gujarati.couplet:
આવા સાધુ મેં ન દીઠા ક્યાંઈ<RHYME_209877>, જાગે ભાગ્ય રહે એ જો આંઈ<RHYME_209877>; 
પછી પ્રીત્યે શું પૂછવા લાગ્યા, કોણ ગુરુ ક્યાં તમારી જાગ્યા.
gujarati.context: A fortunate event has occurred, and one's good fortune is preserved; it is only later that the curiosity arises about what to do with this good fortune.

gujarati.couplet:
કહે હરિ સુણો સાધુ વાત<RHYME_209872>, નહિ ગુરુ સ્વજન માત તાત<RHYME_209872>; 
જેથી છૂટીએ સર્વે સંતાપ<RHYME_209879>, તે જ ગુરુ સ્વજન માઈ બાપ<RHYME_209879>.
gujarati.context: The guru's words are only for one's self, not for others to understand; the person who is enlightened by these words is also the guru's own child.

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે બોલ્યા સુખાનંદ સંત<RHYME_209880>, મહારાજ એ જ છે સિદ્ધાંત<RHYME_209880>; 
પણ પૂછવાની એક રીત્ય<RHYME_209881>, માટે પૂછું છું હું કરી પ્રીત્ય<RHYME_209881>.
gujarati.context: The saint Sukhānd spoke the truth, Mahārāj is that very principle. But I ask myself in humility, what is the true meaning of "righteousness" for me?

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે કહે નીલકંઠ કથી, આવ્યા ઉત્તર કોશલ દેશથી; 
સર્વ તીર્થ ફરતા જોતા ધામ<RHYME_209883>, અમે આવ્યા છઉં આણે ગામ<RHYME_209883>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

Nilekanth came from northern Kosala, seeking spiritual growth; we have returned to our village, leaving behind the worldly pilgrimages.

gujarati.couplet:
અમે કહ્યું અમારું વૃતાંત<RHYME_209880>, તમે કોણના શિષ્ય છો સંત<RHYME_209880>; 
પછી બોલ્યા સુખાનંદ તૈયે, અમે રામાનંદજીના છૈયે.
gujarati.context: We narrate our story, and you are a student of the saints; afterwards, Sukhānand spoke thus, saying we are Ramānandjee's disciples.

gujarati.couplet:
અમ માંહિ મોટા મુક્તાનંદ, તેની આજ્ઞામાં રહું વર્ણીઇન્દ્ર; 
આવ્યો આ વાવ્યે નાવા હું આજ<RHYME_209885>, ત્યાં તો તમે મળ્યા મહારાજ<RHYME_209885>.
gujarati.context: I am free in my own mind, living according to my conscience; today I have arrived at the shore, where you, great king, are also present.

gujarati.couplet:
મોટું ભાગ્ય માન્યું આજ મારું, મને દર્શન થયું તમારું; 
એમ કહીને લાગ્યા છે પાય<RHYME_209887>, આવો અમારી જાયગા માંય<RHYME_209887>.
gujarati.context: Today I consider myself very fortunate to have seen yours; it feels like my words are saying, "Come, let's go to our place".

gujarati.couplet:
ઇયાં વસે છે સંત સુજાણ<RHYME_209888>, વર્તે છે પંચવ્રત પ્રમાણ<RHYME_209888>; 
પ્રભુ તિયાં લગી પધારીજે, દયા કરીને દરશન દીજે.
gujarati.context: The saints reside in the heart, and their path is measured by five principles; may God guide us and grant us a vision of compassion.

gujarati.couplet:
મુક્તાનંદજી જે ઇયાં રહે છે, તે તમ જેવાને મળવા ઇચ્છે છે; 
ગુરુ આજ્ઞાએ અમે રહું છું, તમ જેવાની સેવા કરું છું.
gujarati.context: A person who has attained spiritual freedom (Mukta) longs to be reunited with those of like nature; the guru's will is to serve others of similar disposition as oneself.

gujarati.couplet:
મુક્તાનંદજી સંત છે એવા, સહુને દર્શન કરવા જેવા; 
માટે તમે પધારોને ત્યાંઈ<RHYME_209877>, નહિ તો નિશ્ચે એ આવશે આંઈ<RHYME_209877>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

A liberated soul, like Muktaanandji, seeks spiritual enlightenment; otherwise, it will be reborn and suffer again in this world.

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે વર્ણી બોલ્યા એમ વાણ<RHYME_209888>, તમે સાંભળો સંત સુજાણ<RHYME_209888>; 
શહેર પુર નગર ને ગામ<RHYME_209883>, અમે જાતા નથી કેને ધામ<RHYME_209883>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The poet urges you to listen carefully, just like saints do, as they speak truthfully. The city and village are not different, we don't leave home for another's sake.

gujarati.couplet:
ફર્યા વિષમ વન સઘળે, રહેતા નિત્ય નવા તરુતળે; 
પણ એવાનાં દર્શન સારુ, ચાલો માનીશ વચન તમારું.
gujarati.context: Life is unpredictable and uncertain, but we should still strive to achieve our goals and make the most of each new day.

gujarati.couplet:
પછી સંત સાથે વર્ણીરાય<RHYME_209887>, આવ્યા આપે ધર્મશાળા માંય<RHYME_209887>; 
ઊઠી સંતે કર્યો નમસ્કાર<RHYME_209894>, નમ્યા હરિ સહુને તે વાર<RHYME_209894>.
gujarati.context: The devotee arrived at the dharmashala with the saints and was blessed by their presence. The saint gave his blessings, and the devotee's heart became filled with devotion towards God.

gujarati.couplet:
પછી બેઠા ઘટે તેમ સહુ, શોભી સભા તે સમામાં બહુ; 
સર્વે વર્ણી સામું જોઈ રિયા, દેખી હરિ આશ્ચર્ય પામિયા.
gujarati.context: When we gather together, the atmosphere becomes vibrant and beautiful; it's as if God is surprised by our gathering.

gujarati.couplet:
તપ તેજ તને શાંતપણું, દેખી મન નેણ લોભ્યાં ઘણું; 
કહે આવા ન દીઠા સાંભળ્યા, આજ મોર્યે પણ નથી મળ્યા.
gujarati.context: Wisdom is achieved through spiritual calmness and self-control, not by coveting external things. Nothing has been accomplished that was not meant to be, including my own life, even today.

gujarati.couplet:
બાળપણામાં આવા છે શુદ્ધ<RHYME_209899>, માટે મનુષ્ય નહિ છે વિબુદ્ધ<RHYME_209899>; 
કાં તો ચંદ્ર કાં તો છે આ અર્ક<RHYME_209900>, કાં તો અગ્નિ કે સ્વામી કાર્તિક<RHYME_209900>.
gujarati.context:
In innocence, one is pure and unlearned; a person becomes wise only when they experience the ups and downs of life.

The moon, the sun, or maybe even fire, or my dear friend Kartik - these are the tests that make us wiser.

gujarati.couplet:
કાં તો નિરન્નમુક્ત આ નિદાન<RHYME_209901>, કાં તો તપ છે મૂરતિમાન<RHYME_209901>; 
કાં તો બદ્રિપતિ છે આપ<RHYME_209902>, જુવો એના આવ્યાનો પ્રતાપ<RHYME_209902>.
gujarati.context: Is it the eternal suffering or is it a test of patience? Look at your past deeds, for they reveal your true courage.

gujarati.couplet:
આપણાં નેણ ન લોભે ક્યાંઈ<RHYME_209877>, તે તો રિયાં છે એમાં લોભાઈ<RHYME_209877>; 
માટે આપણાં મોટાં છે ભાગ્ય<RHYME_209903>, મળ્યા મૂર્તિમાન આ વૈરાગ્ય<RHYME_209903>.
gujarati.context: Our attachments are in the world, not in ourselves; it is a sign of attachment when we crave for worldly things. Therefore, we are blessed with great good fortune to have gained renunciation and spiritual wisdom.

gujarati.couplet:
આની સેવા કરો કરભામી, તો રીઝશે રામાનંદ સ્વામી; 
પછી સંત સેવા માંહિ રિયા, મુક્તાનંદે ભોજન કરાવિયાં.
gujarati.context: Serve selflessly, and then you'll become like Lord Ramanand Swami; afterwards, the saintly service will be your own, and Muktanand will provide for you.

gujarati.couplet:
પછી જિતેન્દ્રિય સાધુને જાણી, રાજી થઈ હરિ બોલ્યા વાણી; 
કહે અમે રહેશું તમ પાસ<RHYME_209906>, કરશું ટેલ્ય કરે જેમ દાસ<RHYME_209906>.
gujarati.context: The couplet conveys the devotion of a saint who has gained spiritual understanding and accepts God's will, surrendering his ego to become a humble servant. He says he will reside at God's doorstep, doing what He desires, like a loyal servant.

gujarati.couplet:
પછી સંતમાં રહ્યા મહારાજ<RHYME_209885>, પૂછ્યું પ્રશ્ન પરીક્ષાને કાજ<RHYME_209885>; 
કહે નીલકંઠ સુણો સંત<RHYME_209880>, તમે જાણો છો સર્વે સિદ્ધાંત<RHYME_209880>.
gujarati.context: After the spiritual master's death, I inquired about the reason for the test; The saint replied that you are aware of all principles and laws.

gujarati.couplet:
માટે કરું છું પ્રશ્ન મહારાજ<RHYME_209885>, ઉત્તર સુણવા ઇચ્છું છું આજ<RHYME_209885>; 
જીવેશ્વર માયા બ્રહ્મ જેહ<RHYME_209907>, પરબ્રહ્મ રૂપ કહો તેહ<RHYME_209907>.
gujarati.context: I will ask the great question, I desire to know the answer today; What is my soul's connection with Brahman, or the ultimate form of God?

gujarati.couplet:
કહેજ્યો જુજવાં વિગત્ય પાડી, જેમ છે તેમ દેજ્યો દેખાડી; 
એવાં સૂક્ષ્મ પ્રશ્નને સાંભળી, બોલ્યા મુક્તાનંદજી ત્યાં વળી.
gujarati.context: As one's actions unfold, so too do their consequences; examine the fine details and let Muktanandji's words be your guide.

gujarati.couplet:
કહે સુણ્યું ગુરુમુખે અમે, કહું તે વરણી સુણો તમે; 
સ્થૂળ સૂક્ષ્મ કારણ દેહ<RHYME_209907>, તેમાં વ્યાપ્યો નખશિખા તેહ<RHYME_209907>.
gujarati.context: We seek guidance from the guru's mouth, while you say it is written in our skin; the true cause of this body is hidden, yet manifest in subtle ways.

gujarati.couplet:
ઇન્દ્રિ અંતઃકરણ એ આધારે, કરે ક્રિયા નાના પ્રકારે; 
વળી જાણો અજન્મા છે એહ<RHYME_209907>, નિત્ય નિરંશ અખંડ તેહ<RHYME_209907>.
gujarati.context: The couplet suggests that our thoughts and intentions (indri) influence the actions we take, and these actions can be small or grand in nature; meanwhile, it also reminds us that life is precious and ephemeral, urging us to appreciate its fleeting nature.

gujarati.couplet:
છે પ્રકાશક તે ન છેદાય<RHYME_209911>, ન બળે ન સડે ન સુકાય<RHYME_209911>; 
એવું જાણજ્યો જીવનું રૂપ<RHYME_209912>, હવે કહું ઈશ્વરનું સ્વરૂપ<RHYME_209912>.
gujarati.context: The essence of life is not to be divided, nor crushed or scorched; it's a self-aware form that I now understand as God's form.

gujarati.couplet:
વિરાટ સૂત્રાત્મા દેહ જાણો, અવ્યાકૃતમાં વ્યાપ્યા પ્રમાણો; 
ઉત્પત્તિ સ્થિતિ પ્રલય જેહ<RHYME_209907>, કરે સર્વે જગતનો તેહ<RHYME_209907>.
gujarati.context: The self-knower understands the body is ephemeral and fleeting, while the true essence remains unaffected by time and circumstances. Ultimately, it is only the self that endures through birth, existence, destruction, and rebirth.

gujarati.couplet:
એહ કહ્યું ઈશ્વરનું રૂપ<RHYME_209912>, હવે કહું માયાનું સ્વરૂપ<RHYME_209912>; 
જક્ત માંહિ કહીએ જીવ જેહ<RHYME_209907>, તેના ઉદ્‍ભવનું ક્ષેત્ર તેહ<RHYME_209907>.
gujarati.context: This is a declaration of the speaker's shift in perspective, from recognizing God's form to understanding the true nature of Maya (illusion); now, they will speak about the origin and realm of life itself.

gujarati.couplet:
અનાદિ તમમય તે કહીએ<RHYME_209914>, જડચિદાત્મક એ લહીએ<RHYME_209914>; 
કાર્યકારણ રૂપ એ જાણો, ભગવાનની શક્તિ પ્રમાણો.
gujarati.context: The eternal soul's desire is to be united with the divine, and this union can only be achieved through selfless love; know that God's power is infinite.

gujarati.couplet:
ત્રણ ગુણાત્મક એ કહીએ<RHYME_209914>, અજન્મા અજ્ઞાનરૂપ લહીએ<RHYME_209914>; 
એવું માયાનું રૂપ સરે છે, હરિઆશ્રિત એને તરે છે.
gujarati.context: Three virtues are born out of ignorance at birth; such is the form of Maya, which is sustained by Lord's grace.

gujarati.couplet:
હવે સુણો બ્રહ્મનિરૂપણ<RHYME_209915>, સત્ય જ્ઞાન અનંત પૂરણ<RHYME_209915>; 
અખંડ ને અક્ષર એનું નામ<RHYME_209883>, પુરુષોત્તમને રહેવાનું ધામ<RHYME_209883>.
gujarati.context: Now the Self-realization has to be accomplished, and the infinite fulfillment of truth is to be achieved; The nameless and imperishable Being, who is the ultimate reality, remains forever.

gujarati.couplet:
મૂર્તિમાન અમૂર્ત કહેવાય<RHYME_209916>, શુદ્ધ નિત્ય વિકાર વિનાય<RHYME_209916>; 
માયા ઈશ્વર જીવ તત્ત્વ જેહ<RHYME_209907>, તેનું પ્રકાશક જાણો તેહ<RHYME_209907>.
gujarati.context: A perfect soul is said to be eternal and unchanging, with a pure daily behavior without any corruption; its inner light reveals the divine nature within.

gujarati.couplet:

Indri antahkaraṇ e ādhāre, kare kriyā nānā prakāre; <RHYME_30>
Vaḷī jāṇo ajanmā chhe eh, nitya niransha akhanḍ teh.  <RHYME_30>
transliteration.context: The mind is the abode of thoughts, and it performs various actions in different ways. The soul is eternal, birthless, and deathless, and its true nature is forever unbound.

transliteration.couplet:
Chhe prakāshak te na chhedāy, na baḷe na saḍe na sukāy; <RHYME_31>
Evu jāṇajyo jīvnu rūp, have kahu īshvarnu swarūp.  <RHYME_31>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a divine being that is neither pleased nor displeased, nor does it experience joy or sorrow; it has taken the form of a human and has assumed the attributes of God.

transliteration.couplet:
Virāṭ sūtrātmā deh jāṇo, avyākṛutmā vyāpyā pramāṇo; <RHYME_32>
Utpatti sthiti pralay jeh, kare sarve jagatno teh.  <RHYME_32>
transliteration.context: The self is eternal and beyond the physical body, while the world's creation, existence, and destruction are impermanent. The universe is subject to birth, sustenance, and death, but not the self that transcends these cycles.

transliteration.couplet:
Eh kahyu īshvarnu rūp, have kahu māyānu swarūp; <RHYME_33>
Jakta māhi kahīe jīv jeh, tenā udbhavnu kṣhetra teh.  <RHYME_33>
transliteration.context: The divine form of God is like a sweet melody, and the worldly form is like an echo that reverberates in our soul. Our true home is where we reside eternally, beyond the confines of this physical world.

transliteration.couplet:
Anādi tam-may te kahīe, jaḍ-chidātmak e lahīe; <RHYME_34>
Kārya-kāraṇ rūp e jāṇo, Bhagwānnī shakti pramāṇo.  <RHYME_34>
transliteration.context: The self is a drop of divine consciousness, inseparable from the ultimate reality. Know your actions and their causes, and be guided by the power of God.

transliteration.couplet:
Traṇ guṇātmak e kahīe, ajanmā agnānrūp lahīe; <RHYME_35>
Evu māyānu rūp sare chhe, Hari-āshrit ene tare chhe.  <RHYME_35>
transliteration.context: The soul has a divine nature, and only the ignorant person can mistake it for something else. This illusion is like a mirage, and one attuned to God's will can see through it.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The summary is: The absolute truth (Brahma) is infinite and eternal; the name of God is endless and unutterable.

transliteration.couplet:
Mūrtimān amūrta kahevāy, shuddha nitya vikār vināy; <RHYME_37>
Māyā īshvar jīv tattva jeh, tenu prakāshak jāṇo teh.  <RHYME_37>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the eternal and pure nature of the soul (amūrta), which is unaffected by worldly transformations and impermanence (mūrtimān). It also emphasizes understanding the true nature of God, Jeev (the individual self) and Maya (illusion), through divine revelation.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī sarvādhār eh brahma, jāṇo Varṇīrāṭ eh marma; <RHYME_38>

transliteration.context: The ultimate truth is the self, and understanding this is the vital part. One should not speak of the Absolute Truth (Parabrahman) unless one has truly grasped it.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: Lord Narayana and Vasudeva are free to shine on their own, without external illumination. They have a divine form of blissful existence, where Lord Vishnu, Krishna, and Achyuta all reside together in harmony.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī kahīe avyaya Bhagwān, Akṣhar māyā kāḷ je nidān; <RHYME_40>
Temā shaktie anvay thayā, vaḷī mūrtimān judā rahyā.  <RHYME_40>
transliteration.context: The divine is beyond words and description, its true nature being the ultimate cure for maya's illusions; one should not get trapped in worldly forms and forget their true self.

transliteration.couplet:
Kāḷ māyānā niyantā jeh, sarva kāraṇnā kāraṇ teh; <RHYME_41>
Eh Paramātmā Parabrahma, mumukṣhu jīvone levo marma.  <RHYME_41>
transliteration.context: The Lord, the master of the universe, is the cause of all causes and holds everything in balance; He is the ultimate reality that dwells within every living being's heart.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The couplet emphasizes the importance of seeking guidance from a true guru, who will guide you towards spiritual growth and self-realization. It suggests that one should listen to their guru's words, just as one would follow the natural order of things.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The couplet describes a devotee's longing to see God, likening it to a search for honey in the wilderness. The speaker expresses joy and satisfaction upon finding spiritual fulfillment under the guidance of a guru.

transliteration.couplet:

He muni karyo uttar tame, thayo yathārath jāṇyo ame.  <RHYME_44>
transliteration.context: A person's true nature reveals their pure soul, and when they love God, their heart becomes joyful. When a sage answers, one should know the truth as it unfolds.

transliteration.couplet:
E prashna me pūchhyo chhe bahune, kahetā kaṭhaṇ thayā chhe sahune; <RHYME_45>
Tenī tamane lāgī nahi vār, māṭe tame moṭā niradhār.  <RHYME_45>
transliteration.context:
When faced with a difficult question, don't rush to answer it hastily; instead, ponder deeply and respond thoughtfully. 

Take your time, don't be in a hurry, and only then give a thoughtful response.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The couplet describes the longing to meet a spiritual guide who can purify one's mind and soul. The speaker seeks out such a guide, even willing to endure great hardships.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The couplet says that a person who eats alone and has a gloomy face will get an answer to their question, but they won't be able to enjoy it. Their sorrow will increase like the tears of a widow.

transliteration.couplet:
Em kahetā sāmbhaḷtā gāth, vādhyu het rahyā sant sāth; <RHYME_48>
Nitya prashnanā uttar thāy, suṇī sādhune harṣh na māy.  <RHYME_48>
transliteration.context: A song is sung with a happy soulmate by your side, and the joy of devotion remains unbroken. Daily devotions bring happiness and spiritual growth, not mere imagination.

transliteration.couplet:
Sanskṛut ne prākṛut prashna je, kare uttar na thāy bīje; <RHYME_49>
Pachhī ḍāhyā shiyāṇā je hatā, manuṣhyabuddhi temā na karatā.  <RHYME_49>
transliteration.context: The natural world has its own questions that humans cannot answer; even a foolish person's understanding is not applicable to the workings of fate.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The soul is aware of God's presence and knows its true nature; it listens to the eternal stories of Krishna and becomes pure at heart.

transliteration.couplet:
Rākhyā nīm temā nav chūke, kare tap te paṇ na mūke; <RHYME_51>

transliteration.context:
A person's reputation is not lost until they are forgotten by others; even if they have committed a mistake, they will still be remembered for it.

A humble and pure-hearted devotee like Shrī Harinī is so sacred that even her slightest glance can purify the soul.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāre sādhu kahe Bhagwān, sthir draṣhṭi karo kenu dhyān; <RHYME_52>

transliteration.context: The saint says to listen to God's words and maintain a steady gaze without distraction. The king of Varanasi has been listening to the great sage Muktanandji, so too can you.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The beloved Radha and others consider their Lord as the internal friend, while Brahma, Vishnu, Shiva, and other gods are worshipped through daily devotion.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The avatar (incarnation) of Varaha and others, which holds the earth steady; I know only Kṛuṣhṇa, the ultimate Brahman, as the supreme object of my devotion.

transliteration.couplet:

Te vinā nathī jīvone gati, māre paṇ nathī bīje mati.  <RHYME_55>
transliteration.context: The devotee engages in constant worship and remembrance of God, with every breath and thought offered as a prayer. Without this devotion, the soul would lose its way and forget its true nature.

transliteration.couplet:
Em boliyā chhe bahunāmī, chhe to pote ja Shrī Kṛuṣhṇa Swāmī; <RHYME_56>

transliteration.context: The beloved is situated in many places, yet belongs to Lord Shri Krishna alone. In this season of love, my heart resides in the abode of compassion.
